sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: You're watching Euronews Now with me, Sara Green. Let's take a look at our latest stories.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The war of words over Ukraine heats up again, but have US plans to deploy troops in Eastern Europe pushed Russia a step closer to war on the ground?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Shares in Meta plunge by 20% as Facebook loses users to its younger rival TikTok.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: And we meet the artist whose satirical sketches are a controversial challenge to the status quo in Syria's Idlib province.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The announcement that the U.S. is to deploy more than 3,000 of its troops in Germany,

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Poland and Romania has raised the stakes in the standoff over Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: To be precise, President Joe Biden is ordering 2,000 U.S.-based troops to NATO allies Poland and Germany and shifting 1,000 more from Germany to Romania.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: But they are not being sent to non-NATO member Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: This is not troops that will go into Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: They're not fighting in Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: This is us, this is the United States, abiding by our commitments under Article 5 to support, reassure our partners in the region.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Russia's foreign office in Moscow promptly fired back with a sharply worded objection.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Deputy Foreign Minister Alexander Krushchenko said in remarks carried by the Interfax news agency the unfounded destructive steps will only fuel military tensions and narrow the field for political decisions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Not sending the troops to Ukraine is a move designed to avoid provoking Moscow, who, for its own security, wants guarantees that Ukraine never joins NATO.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile, the diplomatic efforts continue, with President Vladimir Putin telling UK Prime Minister Boris Johnson in a phone call that NATO and its allies are ignoring Russia's security concerns.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: French President Emmanuel Macron is also emphasizing the dialogue route to solve the crisis.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: I'm obviously very concerned about the situation on the ground. I've had many exchanges in recent days with my European counterparts, with President Putin on several occasions and I'll be speaking with President Biden in the next few hours. In any case we're in the process of trying to find common ground." The rush to find that common ground is taking place against growing fears that Russia will invade Ukraine, something President Putin denies.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: U.S. special forces carried out what the Pentagon described as a successful large-scale counter-terrorism

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: raid in northwestern Syria early on Thursday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Local rescue workers said at least 13 people were killed, six of them children, but as yet there's no official confirmation of casualties.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The operation, which lasted around two hours, was in and around the village of Atma in Syria's rebel-held Idlib province near the Turkish border.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The US didn't say who or what was the target, but local residents said it involved helicopters, explosions and machine gun fire.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Idlib is dominated by the Al-Qaeda group and its affiliates, and is home to several top Al-Qaeda operatives.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: But it's also dotted with camps for internally displaced people from Syria's civil war. A Pentagon press secretary, John Kirby, said the mission was a success, that there were no US casualties, and that more information would be provided as it becomes available.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: As negotiations with Russia continue, UK Prime Minister Boris Johnson is facing another crisis at home as the so-called Partygate scandal shows no sign of letting up.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Our reporter Victoria Smith has the latest from London.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Boris Johnson coming under more pressure from his own party with three more MPs now asking for him to leave.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The senior Tory MP Tobias Elwood, a former defence minister, and the backbenchers Sir Gary Streeter and Anthony Magnall, MP for Devon.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: It needs to be 54 MPs that write to the 1922 committee before a vote of no confidence can take place.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: But the pressure is mounting on Boris now as these names continue to be added to the list.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: And of course, what he's doing is trying to hide behind other areas, international areas, trying to be an international statesman.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: We've seen that with his visit to Ukraine, looking at the national agenda, the cost of living, for example, and rolling out this levelling up agenda that he promised to voters in the north of the country back in 2019.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: He's now announced how a five billion euro fund will be spent on areas such as broadband and education and public transport. But will these big diversionary tactics be enough to save him?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: We don't know yet. We wait for the police inquiry to come out, but certainly pressure is continuing to mount from within his own party.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The Northern Ireland Protocol, a linchpin in the Brexit agreement, is on the verge of unravelling.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The region's Agriculture Minister, Edwin Poots, has taken the unilateral decision to halt Irish sea border customs checks as of midnight.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The move sets him on a collision course with Brussels.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The protocol demands that checks on goods from Great Britain must take place at Northern Ireland's ports to make sure they comply with EU laws.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: It effectively creates a customs border in the Irish Sea, the idea being to avoid a hard border between Northern Ireland and its neighbour to the south, the Republic of Ireland.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Poots is a member of the pro-UK Unionist Party, the DUP, which rejects the Northern Ireland Protocol as it stands since it puts a virtual barrier between Belfast and London.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: He believes the checks are unlawful, but last week his bid to force the Stormont executive to rethink on the issue was blocked by Sinn Fein. Since then, he claims a legal loophole allows him to act independently, causing uproar in Dublin, London and Brussels.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Well, this decision by Edwin Poots, the Minister for Agriculture in Northern Ireland, to suspend checks on goods entering Northern Ireland from Great Britain hasn't gone down well with politicians in Dublin.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Last night, the Irish Minister for Foreign Affairs, Simon Coveney, told the Irish Senate that this amount, Simon Coveney, told the Irish Senate that this amounted to a breach of international law. Now there appears to be more to this decision than would at first meet the eye. Traders, members of the public are not complaining about the Northern Ireland Protocol but people in working class loyalist areas, people who are pro-British, believe that what the Northern Ireland Protocol does is it isolates Northern Ireland further away from Great Britain and they believe that this amounts to a slippery slope towards a united Ireland something that they strongly oppose Edwin toots himself is something of an isolated character he has been deselected by his own party the pro-british Democratic Unionist Party, in his own constituency of Lagan Valley.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: And he is looking for a constituency to contest the forthcoming May 5th Assembly elections in Northern Ireland.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Now, the situation as of today is that there's an expectation that the First Minister of Northern Ireland, Paul Gib Given, is going to announce his resignation this afternoon. That will collapse the Northern Ireland Assembly and it's unsure at this moment in time as to whether or not the Assembly elections on May the 5th will actually go ahead. And many people believe that what Edwin Poots did last night in stopping checks on goods entering Northern Ireland from Great Britain amounts to a political stunt to save the skin of the Democratic Unionist Party. So the coming days and weeks are going to be very interesting indeed. This is Ken Ray for Euronews in County Meath in Ireland.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: A new study reveals that coral reefs could completely disappear if global warming exceeds 1.5 degrees Celsius above pre-industrial levels.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Scientists from Australia, the UK and the US have studied their thermal refugia, places which allow coral reefs to recover from climate changes and bleaching.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: They found a 1.5 degree Celsius increase in temperature will cause 99 percent of refugia to vanish and a two degrees increase will leave no safe zones for corals.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: According to the UN, even though coral reefs cover just 0.2% of the global seabed, they host 25% of the ocean's flora and fauna.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Coral extension would set off a chain reaction which could eventually starve half a billion people in countries which depend on marine resources.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: countries, which depend on marine resources.
